CatDescriptText: Mr. Walter Kommer, retired, Bellevue and Miss Peggy Stahl, student, Hampton Township, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 9, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "In your opinion, what do you think is the most effective protest medium Negro people have today?" Mr. Walter Kommer's answer reads: "The peaceable way is sitting down together and reasoning things out."  Miss Peggy Stahl's answer reads: "I think the most effective way is writing to Congressmen, because I don't think sit-ins and freedom rides get anywhere, except in stirring up a lot more trouble."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Walter Kommer wearing dark fedora, eyeglasses, patterned tie, and dark overcoat, posed in front of building; Portrait of Peggy Stahl wearing textured coat with four light colored buttons, and holding books, standing in front of light colored wall
